subject: Re: [junit] Unknown Source when assert fails?
msgSnippet: It depends the option you use to compile your classes try in your compile.test target (that I m not able to find in your build.xml info posted..) to set to
messageBody:
It depends the option you use to compile your classes

try in your compile.test target (that I'm not able to find in your build.xml
info posted..) to set to true the debug attribute in the javac tag.
In my build.xml file I use where debug, optimize and deprecation are ANT
project properties set to true' or 'false'.
<javac
srcdir="source/java"
destdir="${build.home}/classes"
debug="${debug}"
optimize="${optimize}"
deprecation="${deprecation}">
<classpath refid="classpath"/>
</javac>

HTH
Pino

----- Original Message -----
From: "Paul Michali" <pcm@...>
To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, September 18, 2001 8:49 PM
Subject: [junit] Unknown Source when assert fails?


> I have a JUnit framework that I run via Ant. When a test fails, I get
> this output:
>
> [junit] Testcase: testNoFilters took 0 sec
> [junit] FAILED
> [junit] expected:<0> but was:<1>
> [junit] junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: expected:<0> but
> was:<1>
> [junit] at junit.framework.Assert.fail(Assert.java:51)
> [junit] at junit.framework.Assert.failNotEquals(Assert.java:234)
> [junit] at junit.framework.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:68)
> [junit] at junit.framework.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:181)
> [junit] at junit.framework.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:187)
> [junit] at pathfinder.TestPathFinder.testNoFilters(Unknown
> Source)
>
> Anyone know why it is saying "Unknown Source", instead of a line number?
> How
> do I fix this? (I hate to have to dig through JUnit to figure out what
> is
> going on).
>
> I'm running Java 1.3, with Ant, on a Windows NT 4.0 SP6. Here's the
> pertinent
> build.xml info:
>
> <property name="app.name" value="PathFinder" />
> <property name="home" value="${basedir}"/>
> <property name="src.dir" value="${home}/src/pathfinder" />
> <property name="tests.dir" value="${home}/src/tests/pathfinder"
> />
> <property name="classes.dir" value="${home}/classes"/>
> <property name="test.classes.dir" value="${home}/classes/tests" />
>
> <path id="test.classpath">
> <pathelement location="../../javamail-1.2ea2/mail.jar" />
> <pathelement location="../../jakarta-log4j-1.1.3/dist/lib/log4j.jar" />
> <pathelement
> location="../../jakarta-log4j-1.1.3/dist/lib/log4j-core.jar" />
> <pathelement location="../../jaf-1.0.1/activation.jar" />
> <pathelement location="../../junit3.7/src.jar" />
> </path>
>
> <target name="test" depends="compile.tests" if="junit.present"
> description="Runs the JUnit test cases">
>
> <junit fork="yes" printsummary="no" haltonfailure="yes">
> <jvmarg value="-Dtest.home=${test.classes.dir}/pathfinder"/>
> <classpath>
> <pathelement path="${classes.dir}" />
> <pathelement path="${test.classes.dir}" />
> <pathelement path="${test.classes.dir}/pathfinder" />
> <path refid="test.classpath" />
> </classpath>
>
> <formatter type="plain" usefile="false" />
>
> <test name="${main.test.case}" />
> </junit>
> </target>
>
>
> Thanks in advance!!!
>
